Welcome to Heatherr’s documentation!¶

Timezone¶

heatherr.timezone.commands.for_(*args, **kwargs)¶

for <friend’s name>

Print the local timezone and time for a friend on Slack.

Daily or Weekly team check-ins¶

heatherr.checkin.commands.daily_or_weekly(*args, **kwargs)¶

/checkin daily or /checkin weekly

Sets a daily checkin for you for the current channel at 9am in according to the timezone your Slack account profile.

heatherr.checkin.commands.list_checkins(*args, **kwargs)¶

/checkin list

List all of the checkins you’re subscribed to.

heatherr.checkin.commands.remove_checking(*args, **kwargs)¶

/checkin remove #<number>

Remove a checkin, the #number matches the #number returned by list

Definitions¶

heatherr.definitions.bots.add_definition(*args, **kwargs)¶

Teach the bot a definition:

@BOTUSERID: UNICEF is The United Nations Children’s Emergency Fund

@BOTUSERID will respond by adding a :thumbsup: reaction to your message once the definition has been added.

heatherr.definitions.bots.get_definition(*args, **kwargs)¶

Ask the bot for a definition:

@BOTUSERID: what does UNICEF mean? @BOTUSERID: what is UNICEF? @BOTUSERID: UNICEF?

@BOTUSERID will respond with the definitions it knows about. Each definition has a unique number which one can use should it need to be removed.

heatherr.definitions.bots.remove_definition(*args, **kwargs)¶

Remove a definition:

@BOTUSERID: remove 1 for UNICEF

@BOTUSERID will respond by adding a :thumbsup: reaction to your message once it’s been removed.

Group Announcements¶

heatherr.groups.commands.announce(*args, **kwargs)¶

announce <group-name> <your message>

Broadcast a message to all the members in a group

heatherr.groups.commands.create(*args, **kwargs)¶

create <new-group-name>

Create a new group.

heatherr.groups.commands.join(*args, **kwargs)¶

join <group-name>

Join a group.

heatherr.groups.commands.leave(*args, **kwargs)¶

leave <group-name>

Leave a group

heatherr.groups.commands.list(*args, **kwargs)¶

list

List the known groups.

heatherr.groups.commands.members(*args, **kwargs)¶

members <group-name>

List the members in a group.

Random things¶

heatherr.random.commands.poll(*args, **kwargs)¶

/poll Should we jump off a bridge? Yes, No, Maybe?

Create a poll

heatherr.random.commands.slap(*args, **kwargs)¶

/slap @userid

Slaps the @userid
